data.text: occurring, made, or acted upon every day
examples: daily needs
a daily newspaper
a daily schedule
average daily wage
daily statistics

data.text: issued every day or every weekday
examples: daily needs
a daily newspaper
a daily schedule
average daily wage
daily statistics

data.text: of or providing for every day
examples: daily needs
a daily newspaper
a daily schedule
average daily wage
daily statistics
Take one pill twice daily.
They serve lunch at school daily.
Take one pill twice daily.
They serve lunch at school daily.

data.text: a newspaper that is published every day or every day except Sunday
unedited movie footage processed or shared immediately after shooting for review by the cinematographer, director, or producer: rush
a quest or task in a video game that resets every day and for which a small bonus is given when completed
a system of betting (as on horse races) in which the bettor must pick the winners of two stipulated races in order to win
a series of physical exercises to be performed daily: workout
a set of routine duties or tasks
the bottom of something considered as its foundation
examples: Fruit juice constitutes the basis of jelly.
stories with little basis in reality
no legal basis for a new trial
still some basis for hope
selected on the basis of test scores
hired on a trial basis
He is on a first-name basis with his customers.
meets with us on a regular basis =regularly
The department sends reports on a daily basis. =every day
concepts that form the basis of the country's economic policies

data.text: something on which something else is established or based
examples: Fruit juice constitutes the basis of jelly.
stories with little basis in reality
no legal basis for a new trial
still some basis for hope
selected on the basis of test scores
hired on a trial basis
